{{cpp/memory/polymorphic_allocator/title|deallocate}}
{{cpp/memory/polymorphic_allocator/navbar}}

{{ddcl|since=c++17| 
void deallocate( T* p, std::size_t n );
}}

Deallocates the storage pointed to by {{c|p}}, which must have been allocated from a {{lc|std::pmr::memory_resource}} {{tt|x}} that compares equal to {{c|*resource()}} using {{c|x.allocate(n * sizeof(T), alignof(T))}}.

Equivalent to {{c|this-&gt;resource()-&gt;deallocate(p, n * sizeof(T), alignof(T));}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|p|pointer to memory to deallocate}}
{{par|n|the number of objects originally allocated}}
{{par end}}

===Exceptions===
Throws nothing.
